instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00923: What is 820-00923? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO: What is PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO? PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC: What is PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC? PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO is an LDO coming out of the CD3215 USB-C muxing chip. When this is missing, either a capacitor on the line has shorted, PP3V3_G3H is missing, or the CD3215 is bad..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged 5v
threads.message:
Hello, this board was water damaged near to 3100
i replaced it and did some jumpers
USB C stuck on 5v and restart 
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_X_USBC</SIGNAL> 5.0v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.3
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_UPC_XA_LDO</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>P3V3_TBT_X_SX_EN_R</SIGNAL> 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_UPC_XA_LDOA</SIGNAL> 1.8v
<SIGNAL>PP1V1_UPC_XA_LDO_BMC</SIGNAL> 0v

there is some test point are gone because of water damage but not between 2 traces, going in the board

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged 5v
threads.message:
All USB-C port restarts?
Test each one in both connection ways.
1V1 LDO must appear only on the powered port.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged 5v
threads.message:
Yes it is restarting on every port, both sides.
Now i tried to replace <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> to test, but the charger don't turn on on this one...
I put back the old one, same problem...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00923</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Water damaged 5v
threads.message:
If the USB-C meter stays black (0V), you have a problem with VBUS, or CC1/2 lines.
Compare diode mode between all <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chips.
